page.title: 08THE CATTERY AT LOWER HARDRES
page.content: Cottage Cattery in Church Lane was established in 1983 by two veterinary nurses with the backing of the Man- power Services Commission's Small Business Scheme. 30 cats can be boarded for convalescence or whilst owners are unable to care for them. The nurses and one full time assis- tant give a 24 hour care service. All cats must have current enteritis and influenza injections. Standards must satisfy the Environmental Health Inspectors who make regular checks. In spotless white-painted kennels each cat has its own heated house, blanket and favorite toy. There are larger kennels for exercise. Cats are fed according to owners' wishes and dietary instructions hang outside each house. The charge is Â£2 per day which includes collection and delivery service and covers insurance.
